New Records: The victory snapped a streak of 20 straight games in which the White Sox lost Chris Flexen's starts — the longest such stretch in MLB history.
Key Match Events: Dominic Fletcher hit an RBI double in the ninth inning to give the White Sox the lead.
The White Sox tacked on four more runs in the ninth inning for a 7-2 victory.
Fletcher threw out Jarren Duran, who was trying to score from first on a double down the right-field line in the first inning.
Fletcher made a diving catch in right field to rob Rafael Devers of a hit in the sixth inning.
Jacob Amaya made a tremendous diving stop and throw to retire Tyler O’Neill in the sixth inning.
Zach DeLoach hit a two-run single in the ninth inning.
Luis Robert Jr. brought home the final run with a sacrifice fly in the ninth inning.
Justin Anderson struck out two in the ninth inning to secure the win.
Post-Match Reflections: Interim manager Grady Sizemore commented, 'That’s just the kind of game we want to play.'
Chris Flexen reflected on his performance, saying, 'He was hitting the spots, he was making good pitches, keeping them kind of off-balance.'
Flexen also credited the defense for their performance.
Fletcher commented on the importance of adding runs in the ninth inning, 'Any time you can add runs, it’s big.'
Sizemore reflected on the team's performance, 'We played very clean, took care of the ball, made some great plays, good throws.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox need to go 10-8 in their final 18 games to avoid tying the 1962 New York Mets (40-120) for the most losses in Major League Baseball’s modern era.
